name: Tinie Tempah
description:
'''Patrick Chukwuemeka Okogwu''' ({{audio|Ig-Patrick Chukwuemeka Okogwu.ogg|pronunciation}}; born 7 November 1988), better known by his stage name '''Tinie''' (formerly '''Tinie Tempah'''), is an English [[rapper]] and [[singer]]. Born and raised in London, he created his own entertainment company [[Disturbing London]] in 2006, alongside Dumi Oburota. After signing with [[Parlophone]] in 2009 and releasing several [[mixtapes]], he rose to fame with the UK number-one singles "[[Pass Out (Tinie Tempah song)|Pass Out]]" and "[[Written in the Stars (Tinie Tempah song)|Written in the Stars]]" in 2010. 

He subsequently released his debut album ''[[Disc-Overy]]'' in October 2010, which also charted at number one and was certified [[Music recording sales certification|platinum]] in 2011. He won two [[2011 BRIT Awards|Brit Awards]] in 2011 for Best British Breakthrough Act and Best British Single. In November 2013, he released his second album, entitled ''[[Demonstration (Tinie Tempah album)|Demonstration]]''. Preceded by top ten singles "[[Trampoline (Tinie Tempah song)|Trampoline]]" and "[[Children of the Sun (Tinie Tempah song)|Children of the Sun]]", the album charted at number three and was certified gold by the [[British Phonographic Industry|BPI]] the next year. 

In June 2015, he released "[[Not Letting Go]]", the first single from his third album ''[[Youth (Tinie Tempah album)|Youth]]''. This gave Tinie his sixth [[List of UK Singles Chart number ones|UK number one]], surpassing [[Dizzee Rascal]] as the most by any UK rap artist.
